results.title: An Act of faith
results.creator_credit: Robin Whitworth, BBC-TV and John Read
results.brief_description: The story of the new Cathedral at Coventry. Beginning with the blitz that destroyed the medieval church, it moves through all the stages of rebuilding and visits the studios of the artists concerned. Features Graham Sutherland’s gigantic tapestry, Epstein’s St. Michael and the devil, some of the stained glass windows, and the figures engraved on the plate glass entrance.

results.title: Amy!
results.creator_credit: Laura Mulvey, Modelmark and Peter Wollen
results.brief_description: Part newsreel and part biography, this film takes as its subject, the life story of the legendary aviatrix Amy Johnson who was the first woman to fly solo from England to Australia. Mulvey and Wollen pursue their concern, developing radical strategies through a sustained discussion, by a women’s group, of what the “heroic” image means to women including questions of feminism and representation. A commentary on ‘philovatism’ (the desire for thrills) seeks to explain Johnson’s exploits in psychoanalytic terms. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Amy on the lips
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film “Amy” starring Jenny Agutter and Barry Newman. Shows the attempts by one woman to teach deaf children to speak at the turn of this century. Suitable for Upper Primary, Early Secondary students. No other credits available.

results.title: Amy is a tiger
results.creator_credit: Cameracraft Film Productions and Keith Hall
results.brief_description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.

results.title: Amy
results.creator_credit: Cascade Films, Film Victoria, Nadia Tass and David Parker
results.brief_description: Since witnessing the traumatic death of her rock-star father three years earlier, eight-year-old Amy has become mute and deaf, despite doctors declaring her physically fit. Her mother, struggling to make ends meet since the death of her husband, and determined to keep Amy out of the school system, has moved with her daughter to a remote farmhouse. When child welfare officers insist that Amy must return to the city to attend a school for the deaf, mother and daughter flee to the anonymity of a shabby working-class suburb in Melbourne populated by losers and misfits. Amongst this quirky cast of characters (the likes of which were a characteristic element of Australian features of the early nineties including Parker and Tass’ earlier work), they meet a young drop-out musician who finds a way to connect with Amy through music, allowing her to regain her voice through song. Despite a strong cast, the film suffers from an attempt to embrace a range of genres and styles including slapstick comedy, musical, family melodrama and gritty realism. Cast includes Alana De Roma, Rachel Griffiths, Ben Mendelsohn, Nick Barker and Kerry Armstrong.

results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders. - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Uses excellent close-up photos and cinematography to show a typical amphibian life-cycle and to study the differences between three kinds of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Amphibians: frogs, toads and salamanders
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Film Associates of California
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by the creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis as well as their anatomical and physiological characteristics.

results.title: Amphibians
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads, and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by these three creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis; feeding habits; hibernation; cold-bloodedness, skin and skeletal characteristics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Ampex H.S 100 video disc recorder
results.brief_description: Ampex H.S 100 video disc recorder. One of the first units used on Australian television to facilitate ‘slow mo’ replays of football action. Disc capacity approx 9 seconds. Includes one x spare 15” disc. Circa 1960s/70s
